title: Simulation Education Fellowship Design: Curriculum Development Based on the 4-Component Instructional Design Model

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in medical simulation education or demonstrated leadership competencies
context.additional_context: Designed for managers/leaders responsible for corporate medical simulation training programs. Asynchronous learning in smartphone-based limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Students can develop a simulation-based education curriculum framework with over 80% accuracy using the Four-Component Instructional Design (4C/ID) model.
Based on learner needs analysis, students can create simulation scenario design guidelines and incorporate peer-reviewed feedback through at least three revisions.
Learners can design a self-assessment logbook optimized for mobile environments and measure educational outcomes using at least three quantitative metrics.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
